page.title: 04Farming on Herm.
page.content: Herm has a dairy farm which has one of the biggest herds of dairy cows in the Channel Islands. It is run by two farmers. There are about eighty head of cattle with fifty-five milkers. They give about five hundred and forty litres of milk a day. Most of the milk is exported daily to Guernsey. It is taken in milk churns by boat to the Guernsey dairy where it is pasteurised. There are also bulls, calves and heifers. Herm has about eighty acres of good pasture all within close reach of the farm, and another twenty acres of brakes. 11 acres can be irrigated. In summer grass is cut for winter silage. Hay and straw have to be imported, but the cows bed down happily on sand from a sand pit on the common.
